dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4176 IH: GRAD Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. McClellan (for herself, Ms. Adams, Mr. Carter of Louisiana, Ms. Clarke of New York, Ms. Norton, Ms. Jackson Lee, Mr. Payne, Ms. Garcia of Texas, and Ms. Sewell) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to include certain part B institutions to be eligible for certain grants, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Growing Reputable Academic Departments Act or the GRAD Act.

subsection.text: Section 723 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1136a) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(1), by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: A part B institution (as defined in section 322) that—

clause.text: offers a qualified masters degree program; and
is not listed under subparagraphs (A) through (R).

paragraph.text: in subsection (f)(3), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A)—

subparagraph.text: by striking any amount in excess of $9,000,000 and inserting after the application of paragraph (2), the remaining amount; and

subsection.text: Section 724 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1136b) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(1), by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: A Predominantly Black Institution (as defined in section 318) that—

clause.text: offers a qualified masters degree program; and
is not listed in subparagraphs (A) through (E).

paragraph.text: in subsection (f)(3), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A)—

subparagraph.text: by striking any amount in excess of $2,500,000 and inserting after the application of paragraph (2), any remaining amount; and
by striking through (E) and inserting through (F).
